channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: Lineup Publishingは、Deadspinは「賭けコンテンツ」を含むが、SEOクリックファームにはならないと主張し、削除された投稿を元に戻すと述べている（Kate Knibbs/Wired）
item.description:
Kate Knibbs / Wired:
Lineup Publishing says Deadspin will include “betting content” but insists the outlet won't become an SEO clickfarm, and restores deleted posts  —  The future of once-beloved sports blog Deadspin has been murky since it was acquired by an unknown company called Lineup Publishing in March.

item.title: ベテランのエンターテインメント・ジャーナリスト、ジェド・ローゼンツヴァイクが2月に立ち上げた、深夜テレビを追うニュースサイト兼ニュースレター「LateNighter」についてのインタビュー（David Bauder/Associated Press）。
item.description:
David Bauder / Associated Press:
An interview with veteran entertainment journalist Jed Rosenzweig about LateNighter, his news site and newsletter launched in February to follow late-night TV  —  At first glance, Jed Rosenzweig's new venture would seem like a fool's errand: launching a digital news site during brutal economic times …

item.title: ニコラス・クリストフとのQ&A：海外特派員のセキュリティはどう変わったか、より多くの報道とより少ない評論の必要性、情報源の保護、その他（オリバー・ダーシー/CNN）
item.description:
Oliver Darcy / CNN:
Q&A with Nicholas Kristof on how security for foreign correspondents has changed, the need for more reporting and less punditry, protecting sources, and more  —  Editor's Note: A version of this article first appeared in the “Reliable Sources” newsletter.

item.title: ストリーミング放送事業者は、解約を避け、放送局を模倣するために、手続き番組やシットコムのようなリニアなコンテンツを15話または16話のシーズンで注文している（Michael Schneider/Variety）
item.description:
Michael Schneider / Variety:
Streamers are ordering linear-esque content, like procedurals and sitcoms, with 15- or 16-episode seasons, as they seek to avoid churn and emulate broadcasters  —  There's a reason the most successful night of primetime used to be branded “Must See TV.”  In the late 1990s, NBC's “ER” …

item.title: BBCロシア、BBCペルシャ、BBCアラビアのジャーナリストに、BBCワールドサービスの310人の亡命ジャーナリスト、検閲との戦いなどについてインタビュー（Clara Aberneithie/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Clara Aberneithie / Press Gazette:
Interviews with journalists from BBC Russia, BBC Persia, and BBC Arabic about BBC World Service's 310 exiled journalists, fighting censorship, and more  —  How are BBC World Service stories reaching audiences in authoritarian states and how do journalists report when exiled?

item.title: AI検索の登場は、ウェブ検索に頼ってビジネスを発見したり、ブログ記事を読んだり、ジャーナリズムに資金を提供したりしていたすべての人に不吉な兆しをもたらす（Casey Newton/Platformer）
item.description:
Casey Newton / Platformer:
AI search's arrival bodes ill for everyone who relied on web search to have their business discovered, their blog post read, or their journalism funded  —  When Sundar Pichai took the stage at Google I/O on Tuesday morning, he said that the rise of generative artificial intelligence would provide …

item.title: アダム・モセリによると、スレッドは数ヶ月間インスタグラムとフェイスブックのネットワークにおんぶに抱っこだった後、独自のファクトチェック・プログラムを「最近ロールアウトした」（Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Ivan Mehta / TechCrunch:
Adam Mosseri says Threads “recently rolled out” its own fact-checking program after piggybacking on Instagram and Facebook's network for a few months  —  Meta's newest social network, Threads is starting its own fact-checking program after piggybacking on Instagram and Facebook's network for a few months.

item.title: 偽の研究が科学雑誌の出版社に溢れ、撤回と数百万ドルの収入減を招き、ワイリー社は19誌の閉鎖を計画（Nidhi Subbaraman/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Nidhi Subbaraman / Wall Street Journal:
Fake studies have flooded publishers of scientific journals, resulting in retractions and millions of dollars in lost revenue; Wiley plans to close 19 journals  —  Wiley to shutter 19 more journals, some tainted by fraud  —  Fake studies have flooded the publishers of top scientific journals …

item.title: NYTの記者たちがジョー・カーン編集長に宛てた公開書簡の草稿を回覧し、最近の若手記者を見下した発言を批判している（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
NYT reporters are circulating a draft of an open letter to Joe Kahn, criticizing the editor over recent comments they said were dismissive of young reporters  —  The Scoop  —  New York Times reporters are circulating a draft of an open letter to Joe Kahn, criticizing the paper's top editor …

item.title: 2013年にノーベル文学賞を受賞し、「現代短編小説の巨匠」と呼ばれたカナダの作家アリス・マンロが92歳で死去（Anthony DePalma/New York Times）
item.description:
Anthony DePalma / New York Times:
Canadian author Alice Munro, who won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2013 and was referred to as “a master of the contemporary short story”, dies at 92  —  Her stories were widely considered to be without equal, a mixture of ordinary people and extraordinary themes.

item.title: 情報筋ジミー・フィンケルスタインは、『The Messenger』の失敗後、計画段階にある新事業への関心を喚起するため、潜在的投資家と面会した（Justin Baragona/The Daily Beast）。
item.description:
Justin Baragona / The Daily Beast:
Sources: Jimmy Finkelstein met with potential investors to drum up interest in a new venture, which is in the planning stages, after The Messenger's failure  —  MESSENGER, PT. DEUX  —  The 76-year-old media mogul is apparently looking to clear his name after The Messenger spectacularly flopped.

item.title: TikTokのクリエイター8人が、TikTokの売却または禁止を強制する法律について米国政府を提訴、この動きは彼らの憲法修正第1条の権利を侵害するとしている（ワシントン・ポスト紙）
item.description:
Washington Post:
Eight TikTok creators sue the US government over the law forcing a sale or ban of TikTok, arguing the move violates their First Amendment rights  —  The lawsuit is the second legal challenge to the new law, which creators say violates their First Amendment rights.

item.title: グーグル、テキストでループを作成する機能を含む音楽ツール群「Music AI Sandbox」を公開、公開時期は明らかにせず（Ty Pendlebury/CNET）
item.description:
Ty Pendlebury / CNET:
Google unveils Music AI Sandbox, a suite of music tools that include the ability to create loops via text, without disclosing when it will be publicly available  —  Producers say the AI-generated loops can make music sound ‘more human.’  —  Google has unveiled a new music-making tool …

item.title: YouTubeは、政府が「栄光あれ香港」抗議歌の禁止を求めた後、32の動画リンクをブロックする香港の裁判所命令に従うと発表した（Jeffrey Dastin/Reuters）
item.description:
Jeffrey Dastin / Reuters:
YouTube says it will comply with a Hong Kong court order to block 32 video links, after the government sought to ban the Glory to Hong Kong protest anthem  —  Alphabet's (GOOGL.O) YouTube on Tuesday said it will comply with a Hong Kong court decision and block access to 32 video links deemed to be prohibited content.

item.title: NPRのデイヴィッド・フォルケンフリックとFloodlightのミランダ・グリーンによる、地元紙リッチモンド・スタンダードがいかにしてシェブロンの口車に乗せられたかを暴くQ&A（Neel Dhanesha/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Neel Dhanesha / Nieman Lab:
Q&A with NPR's David Folkenflik and Floodlight's Miranda Green on uncovering how The Richmond Standard, a local newspaper, was set up as Chevron's mouthpiece  —  “It's information.  But it's not news.”  —  In March, NPR's David Folkenflik and Miranda Green of Floodlight co-published …
